channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NJ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NJ

item.title: Report X-2023120446
item.description:
Report X-2023120446

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at hazmat during the sunrise sort, in a plastic bin. DescribePack: Inspection of "MEDIVATORS RAPICIDE PA" showed package to be wet, from internal leakage, and torn open, with evidence of being upside down. Damage most likely caused from being placed on wrong conveyor belt. DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: Remaining contents will be returned to shipper in a plastic salvage drum, unless otherwise stated.

item.title: Report X-2023120430
item.description:
Report X-2023120430

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-05
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon inspection there are four plastic 4 Liter bottles of ColorWright Wright-Giemsa stain inside the fiberboard box. Two of the plastic four-liter bottles have cracks on the seam by the handle causing the liquid to leak throughout the fiberboard box. The box is stained from purple liquid. DescribePack: The seams on the two plastic bottles of ColorWright Wright-Giemsa Stain cracked. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: Plastic bottles were placed inside hazardous material plastic bags.

item.title: Report X-2023120191
item.description:
Report X-2023120191

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE OF DIETHYL ETHER WAS FOUND TO BE CRACKED AND LEAKED OUT . THE CRACKED GLASS WAS PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE SCRAPPED UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF DIETHYL ETHER CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING DROPPED OR MISHANDLED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGED DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

  • Description: X-2023120141, X-2023120142: SequenceEvent: DURING THE OVERNIGHT SORT THE PACKAGE ARRIVED AT THE HAZMAT CAGE SHOWING OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTERNAL LEAKAGE. UPON INSPECTION ONE BOTTLE OF ZEP ACIDIC TOILET BOWEL CLEANER WAS FOUND WITH THE CAP OFF WHICH CAUSED IT TO LEAK. REMAINING CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A SALVAGE DRUM TO BE RETURED TO SHIPPER UNLESS OTHERWISE. DescribePack: FAILURE OF ZEP ACIDIC TOILET BOWEL CLEANER CAUSED FROM THE PACKAGE BEING MISHANDLED OR DROPPED. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: THE CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM TO AWAIT DISPOSITION.

item.title: Report X-2023120130
item.description:
Report X-2023120130

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-15T21:09:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-27
  • City: KEASBEY
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During the sunrise sort, the package arrived at the hazmat cage wet with what seems like paint. Upon inspection 1 paint can was found bubble wrapped with the paint cap popped opened and the paint spilled. Paint can did not contain clips. Package was placed into a salvage drum to await disposition. DescribePack: The package failure was due to a semi open paint can lid, due to not being properly closed and sealed with paint clips. Paint can leaked out entirely due to the open lid. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately placed into a salvage drum upon arrival at the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2023120065
item.description:
Report E-2023120065

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-16
  • City: LAKEWOOD
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-30ft area of the asphalt/concrete parking lot, the trailer floor and concrete dock floor and estimated that ten (10) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 275-gallon poly tote. Enviroserve personnel gravity transferred the remaining product to a new poly tote and the damaged tote was cut-up and placed into one 55-gallon poly drum. The new 275-gallon poly tote was shipped on to the consignee. Enviroserve personnel deployed a neutralizer to the impacted areas and then used a granular absorbent to gather the spent material. The recovered material was containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023120062
item.description:
Report E-2023120062

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: NORTH BERGEN
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 10ft-by-53ft area of the trailer floor and 2ft-by-2ft area of the asphalt terminal lot under the trailer and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to one (1) damaged/leaking 55-gallon metal drum that had been punctured by other freight. First Call Environmental personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted areas and then wiped down all impacted packaged in the trailer with rags. The spent absorbents were gathered and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The damaged 55- gallon metal drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

The remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum to be returned to shipper unless otherwise. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Contents were placed into a lined salvage drum to await disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023111251
item.description:
Report X-2023111251

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: DOVER
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During sort package came down the line wet and leaking. Inspection identified that inner bottle of stain remover top came off which caused significant leak. Per SDS, product is a hazard material but outer Packaging has no Hazard markings . Package shipped as Undeclared DescribePack: Top of inner container came off at some point during shipping. As a result, container leaked entire content - destroying outer package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: once damage identified, package separated from other sort packages and placed in a hazmat bag and bin for further processing.

However, the pilots asked my colleague who manage the situation to place the device in the TCB as prevention. Device would not turn off.

item.title: Report I-2023090078
item.description:
Report I-2023090078

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-05
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: REPUBLIC AIRWAYS HOLDINGS INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Per report from United Alrlines Sr Manager Airport Ops (Olivia Boles), UA3612 YUL arrived to C109 at 18:39, while crew was downloading the flight, they noticed a bag was smoking. They moved it away from the aircraft and called ARFF and Police. Upon inspection they found melted wet swimwear in the bag along with an air tag in a plastic bag. Phone 732.306.0228, olivia.boles@united.com I have asked for a report and not received one. but the Deputy fire chief reported the following: "ARFF did respond and the call originated from the EWR PAPD desk. On arrival it was found that a bag had been damaged from heat or fire. Rescue 8 and Truck 4 responded which is typical outside of an alert dispatched by EANS. Upon investigation the ARFF crew found an Apple Air Tag overheating (tracking device) that also caused several wet bathing suits to melt in addition to the damaged bags. These tags have a lithium based battery and exposure to ater causes these thermal type events." I also reached out to the customer [REDACTED BY GEM/DATA OPS], who sent me pictures of the air tag (which was returned to her on site), it did not appear damaged and functioned normally. She also indicated the air tag was not on the side of the bag where the melteg hole was located. Phone [REDACTED BY GEM/DATA OPS]
